DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe the reason for cessation of menstrual cycle periods.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The reason the Menstrual Cycle involving regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization ends.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days._The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

PermissibleValues.value: I had hormone replacement therapy (not including hormone therapy for cancer).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: RAEB: Treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.

PermissibleValues.value: I had chemotherapy, radiation therapy or hormone therapy that stopped my periods.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04): use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level. The treatment may include administration of hormones or hormone analogs to the patient, or decreasing the level of hormones in the body by using hormone antagonists, or hormone ablation therapy. The concept covers but not limited to: intermittent or permanent hormone suppression or ablation in treatment of hormone-dependent tumors, hormone replacement therapy of any kind, hormonal component of gender reassignment therapy, hormonal contraception, surgical and radiation castration.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.

PermissibleValues.value: I had my ovaries removed (but did not have a hysterectomy).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of one or both ovaries.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete removal of one or both of the ovaries.

PermissibleValues.value: I had a hysterectomy but still have my ovaries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (hiss-ter-EK-toe-mee) An operation in which the uterus is removed.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine): The surgical removal of one or both ovaries.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
Partial or complete removal of one or both of the ovaries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A description for something that exists in or is produced by nature, and is not artificial or man-made.: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.

Concepts.definition: A description for something that exists in or is produced by nature, and is not artificial or man-made.
The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

PermissibleValues.value: I am on birth control that stopped my menstrual periods.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To put into action or service.: The event of being born.: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.

Concepts.definition: To put into action or service.
The event of being born.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To be pregnant. When followed by a numeral, the term indicates how many times a woman has been pregnant, regardless of the outcome of the pregnancy.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The nursing of an infant at the mother's breast.

Concepts.definition: A woman who currently is pregnant or has been in the past, irrespective of the pregnancy outcome.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The nursing of an infant at the mother's breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

Concepts.definition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

PermissibleValues.value: I had a hysterectomy and don't have ovaries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (hiss-ter-EK-toe-mee) An operation in which the uterus is removed.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: The surgical removal of one or both ovaries.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Partial or complete removal of one or both of the ovaries.

PermissibleValues.value: I had a hysterectomy, but I'm not sure if I have ovaries.
